options.description: help for bash
disable completion descriptions

subcommands.name: k9s completion bash
subcommands.raw_help_text:
Generate the autocompletion script for the bash shell.

This script depends on the 'bash-completion' package.
If it is not installed already, you can install it via your OS's package manager.

To load completions in your current shell session:

	source <(k9s completion bash)

To load completions for every new session, execute once:

#### Linux:

	k9s completion bash > /etc/bash_completion.d/k9s

#### macOS:

	k9s completion bash > $(brew --prefix)/etc/bash_completion.d/k9s

You will need to start a new shell for this setup to take effect.

Usage:
  k9s completion bash

Flags:
  -h, --help              help for bash
      --no-descriptions   disable completion descriptions
subcommands.description: Generate the autocompletion script for bash

options.description: help for fish
disable completion descriptions

subcommands.name: k9s completion fish
subcommands.raw_help_text:
Generate the autocompletion script for the fish shell.

To load completions in your current shell session:

	k9s completion fish | source

To load completions for every new session, execute once:

	k9s completion fish > ~/.config/fish/completions/k9s.fish

You will need to start a new shell for this setup to take effect.

Usage:
  k9s completion fish [flags]

Flags:
  -h, --help              help for fish
      --no-descriptions   disable completion descriptions
subcommands.description: Generate the autocompletion script for fish

options.description: help for powershell
disable completion descriptions

subcommands.name: k9s completion powershell
subcommands.raw_help_text:
Generate the autocompletion script for powershell.

To load completions in your current shell session:

	k9s completion powershell | Out-String | Invoke-Expression

To load completions for every new session, add the output of the above command
to your powershell profile.

Usage:
  k9s completion powershell [flags]

Flags:
  -h, --help              help for powershell
      --no-descriptions   disable completion descriptions
subcommands.description: Generate the autocompletion script for powershell

options.description: help for zsh
disable completion descriptions

subcommands.name: k9s completion zsh
subcommands.raw_help_text:
Generate the autocompletion script for the zsh shell.

If shell completion is not already enabled in your environment you will need
to enable it.  You can execute the following once:

	echo "autoload -U compinit; compinit" >> ~/.zshrc

To load completions in your current shell session:

	source <(k9s completion zsh)

To load completions for every new session, execute once:

#### Linux:

	k9s completion zsh > "${fpath[1]}/_k9s"

#### macOS:

	k9s completion zsh > $(brew --prefix)/share/zsh/site-functions/_k9s

You will need to start a new shell for this setup to take effect.

Usage:
  k9s completion zsh [flags]

Flags:
  -h, --help              help for zsh
      --no-descriptions   disable completion descriptions
subcommands.description: Generate the autocompletion script for zsh

options.description: help for completion

subcommands.name: k9s completion
subcommands.raw_help_text:
Generate the autocompletion script for k9s for the specified shell.
See each sub-command's help for details on how to use the generated script.

Usage:
  k9s completion [command]

Available Commands:
  bash        Generate the autocompletion script for bash
  fish        Generate the autocompletion script for fish
  powershell  Generate the autocompletion script for powershell
  zsh         Generate the autocompletion script for zsh

Flags:
  -h, --help   help for completion

Use "k9s completion [command] --help" for more information about a command.
subcommands.description: Generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell

options.description: help for info

subcommands.name: k9s info
subcommands.raw_help_text:
List K9s configurations info

Usage:
  k9s info [flags]

Flags:
  -h, --help   help for info

options.description: help for version
Prints K9s version info in short format

subcommands.name: k9s version
subcommands.raw_help_text:
Print version/build information

Usage:
  k9s version [flags]

Flags:
  -h, --help    help for version
  -s, --short   Prints K9s version info in short format

name: k9s
raw_help_text:
K9s is a CLI to view and manage your Kubernetes clusters.

Usage:
  k9s [flags]
  k9s [command]

Available Commands:
  completion  Generate the autocompletion script for the specified shell
  help        Help about any command
  info        List K9s configurations info
  version     Print version/build info

Flags:
  -A, --all-namespaces                 Launch K9s in all namespaces
      --as string                      Username to impersonate for the operation
      --as-group stringArray           Group to impersonate for the operation
      --certificate-authority string   Path to a cert file for the certificate authority
      --client-certificate string      Path to a client certificate file for TLS
      --client-key string              Path to a client key file for TLS
      --cluster string                 The name of the kubeconfig cluster to use
  -c, --command string                 Overrides the default resource to load when the application launches
      --context string                 The name of the kubeconfig context to use
      --crumbsless                     Turn K9s crumbs off
      --headless                       Turn K9s header off
  -h, --help                           help for k9s
      --insecure-skip-tls-verify       If true, the server's caCertFile will not be checked for validity
      --kubeconfig string              Path to the kubeconfig file to use for CLI requests
      --logFile string                 Specify the log file (default "/root/.local/state/k9s/k9s.log")
  -l, --logLevel string                Specify a log level (error, warn, info, debug) (default "info")
      --logoless                       Turn K9s logo off
  -n, --namespace string               If present, the namespace scope for this CLI request
      --readonly                       Sets readOnly mode by overriding readOnly configuration setting
  -r, --refresh float32                Specify the default refresh rate as a float (sec) (default 2)
      --request-timeout string         The length of time to wait before giving up on a single server request
      --screen-dump-dir string         Sets a path to a dir for a screen dumps
      --splashless                     Turn K9s splash screen off
      --token string                   Bearer token for authentication to the API server
      --user string                    The name of the kubeconfig user to use
      --write                          Sets write mode by overriding the readOnly configuration setting

Use "k9s [command] --help" for more information about a command.
